New Records: The Detroit Tigers ended a 10-year postseason drought with their win.
The Chicago White Sox set a modern major league record with their 121st loss.
Key Match Events: The Tigers broke a scoreless tie in the fifth inning with a wild pitch.
Greene put Detroit ahead 3-1 with a double in the seventh inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The Tigers had been the hottest team in the majors with 31 wins in 42 games since August 11.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Detroit's strong performance in August and September helped them secure the wild card berth.
